column4: hi. i'm having trouble with natty and 2 huawei mobile broadband devices
on 3 different machines
and 3 different service providers
why won't Natty show mobile broadband connections even when the modem flashes blue?
at what level are things going wrong?
do the syslog show that it is recognized as a modem?
how to access syslog?
pull the modem out, open a terminal, type tailf /var/log/syslog and stick the modem in again - watch the messages
it looks like it does recognize. but it wants to perform some 'Auto usb0' and it fails to connect
that's for the huawei e153. it doesn't do this for the huawei e180
log says DHCPv4 request timed out
ok, one easy thing to try: open another terminal and type there:  eject sr1   -- and watch the log in the other window - I have to do that with my 3G every time (it pretends to be a CD)
mine pretends to be both. it shows up twice in the disk utility
when I eject the fake CD then it behaves like a modem and is treated and recognized as such by the system
nothing happens. no complaints, nothing. can't eject from disk utility either
there's option to 'safe removal'. should i do this?
I never tried from the GUI, only from terminal - with    eject sr1
what model and what firmware you got?
its not a huawei,  (ZTE mf626), but while searching I often cam across posts with huawei problem/suggestions, they seem to be not *that* different
it works sometimes. that's the thing. its so unpredictable
I fear that I lead you a little astray - but if it "works sometimes" then try to look into /var/log/syslog when it does and when it doesn't so you can maybe find a reason
no thank you. i learn about reading the logs
please have a look at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/NetworkManager/Hardware/3G  - no solutions but maybe some hints
please keep your comments here to ubuntu support only
